newsitem.title: FRANCE: One-day Paris public transport strike called.
newsitem.headline: One-day Paris public transport strike called.

text.p: Three trade unions on Thursday called a 24-hour Paris public transport strike for November 15 to press demands for jobs, wage increases and improved security to protect staff.

The strike, which could badly disrupt bus and Metro underground railway services, will coincide with a week of protests called for November 12-16 by the Communist-led CGT union to demand wage increases, protest against job cuts and urge a halt to privatisation.

It will also coincide with the first anniversary of Prime Minister Alain Juppe's announcement of an unpopular welfare reform. The reform triggered a 24-day wave of strikes that crippled the capital in November-December last year.
